page.title: 19Dartmoor Weather
page.content: Apart from the Lake District, Dartmoor is the wettest and, possibly, the bleakest area in England. It has an annual average rainfall of 90 inches and an annual average temperature of 50 degrees F. In 1982 the rainfall was 87.58ins; in 1983 it was 77.79ins and in 1984 (a good summer) it was 76.49ins. The heaviest rainfall occurs in the winter months but summers can be wet too. The greatest inconvenience to someone living here, though, is not the amount of rain but the occurrence of low lying mist which can blanket the moor for several days on end or the snow and ice in winter which can make travelling hazardous or impossible. However, when the weather is kind Dartmoor is, indeed, very beautiful and a clean and healthy place to live.
